citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water
citeinfo.title: AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN: Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems of Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, 1:48,000, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

citeinfo.othercit: This data set was provided to personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) on October 28, 2011 by the Division of Water, Indiana Department of Natural Resources personnel. The data was provided in an ESRI shapefile format,and was named "AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN.SHP". This file was approved for public distribution by the Indiana Department of Natural Resources (IDNR), Division of Water (DOW). This map was compiled from multiple unpublished work maps based on USGS quadrangles and at a 1:24,000 scale, and is intended for use at a scale of 1:48,000 or smaller.

descript.abstract:
AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows unconsolidated aquifer systems of the state of Indiana at a scale of 1:48,000. The following is excerpted from the IDNR DOW website, Aquifer Systems Mapping 1:48,000 <http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/4302.htm> Aquifer Systems Mapping Methods:
"The maps, with accompanying text and tables, describe characteristics such as geologic materials, thickness of confining units, aquifer thickness, static water levels, well yield, typical well depths, and depth to the aquifer resource. The counties within the northern Basin Studies were adapted from that series to complete statewide coverage in a uniform style. The basin study aquifer system names are unique and are described on those county map adaptations, and in more detail within the cited publication. All of the unconsolidated mapping is intended for use at a scale of 1:48,000 or smaller."
For questions or comments, contact the IDNR DOW by phone (317) 232-4160 (option 4), E-mail water_inquiry@dnr.IN.gov, or mail at Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water, 402 West Washington Street, Room W264, Indianapolis, IN 46204.
descript.purpose: AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN was created to provide a digital coverage of the unconsolidated (sand and gravel) aquifer systems of the state of Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS, from new 2003-2011 county-based aquifer systems mapping and preexisting published paper maps (Water Resource Availability in the St. Joseph River Basin, Indiana (1987); Water Resource Availability in the Kankakee River Basin, Indiana (1990); Water Resource Availability in the Lake Michigan Region, Indiana (1994); and Water Resource Availability in the Maumee River Basin, Indiana (1996)).

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

dataqual.logic: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.
dataqual.complete: In conducting the mapping, hundreds of water well records were evaluated, especially those having relatively complete information on well location, construction, pump test, and lithology. There were many areas in the counties with sparse information because of lack of well records or incomplete records. Few wells are being drilled in parts of the county served by a public water system. County-based mapping in places show the surface coal mine area coverage (see Indiana Map, IGS COAL_MINE_SURFACE_IN shapefile) and discuss groundwater potential for coal mine spoil areas. This is only available for individual counties on the IDNR DOW Aquifer Systems Mapping page at http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/4302.htm.

horizpa.horizpar: The locations of many wells were field checked and the locations posted on 7.5 minute topographic maps. Visual confirmation of wells was not always possible. Many locations were based only on the street address, driving directions, or other location information provided on the well record.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water
citeinfo.title: Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems of Indiana

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

procstep.procdesc: Mapping of the aquifer systems rely heavily on the IDNR/DOW digital water well record database (about 400,000 records available online) along with other useful digital information (see Indiana Map) where available (e.g. seismic data, bedrock topography maps, soil surveys, oil and gas wells). In addition, publications by the U.S. Geological Survey, Indiana Geological Survey, and other entities were very helpful. Relatively uniform characteristics are the basis for the naming of an aquifer system. However, some variation between counties is possible. See a particular county of interest for specific details. The original coverage, Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000) boundaries, was merged and the lines separating the units removed. The resulting coverage was converted to a shapefile named "AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN." A polygon coverage was created and attributed, and the shapefile provided to IGS personnel.
procstep.srcused: Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000), various digital data layers and paper map sources

cntperp.cntorg: Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water

procstep.procdesc: This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated

attr.attrdef: Name of the unconsolidated unit as a whole from the surface to the top of bedrock, including water-bearing and non water-bearing units
attr.attrdefs: IDNR DOW Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000)

attr.attrdef: Type of material and/or vertical position within the aquifer system
attr.attrdefs: IDNR DOW Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000)

attr.attrdef: Thickness of the water producing aquifer unit(s) in feet
attr.attrdefs: IDNR DOW Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000)

attr.attrdef: Water production in gallons per minute (gpm) as reported on water well records and registered significant water withdrawal facility forms; the terms "typically, generally,and commonly" refer to the middle 60% statistically for reported domestic yield or reported capacity for registered significant groundwater withdrawal wells (defined as 70 gpm or greater)
attr.attrdefs: IDNR DOW Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000)

attr.attrdef: Hyperlink <http://www.in.gov/dnr/water/4302.htm> to more detailed information regarding the Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000) program with links to individual county pages with text including groundwater vulnerability to contamination, a high-capacity table, and Basin Study publications
attr.attrdefs: IDNR DOW Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems Mapping (1:48,000)

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [AQUIFER_SYSTEMS_UNCONSOLIDATED_IDNR_IN: Unconsolidated Aquifer Systems of Indiana (Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Water, 1:48,000, Polygon Shapefile)]
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
